comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: The Fairy Queen beside the conductor especially looks REALLY happy!  No wonder Waterpark were no good at rugby going around in pyjamas all the time!

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content:
Fairies, pixies, an animal or two. A King and a Queen fairy, obviously. The dude behind the conductor could be a flower. I'm guessing that all the taller lads at the back are supposed to be humans, as are some of the front row.

Something based on A Midsummer Night's Dream, maybe?

comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/swordscookie] On the other hand, Waterpark fly halves really did have wings!

comment._content: Nice riposte Carol and they did not need a well known caffeine crammed soft drink to get them either!

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/thehomegnome] By George, I think you've got it! It's not a parasol at all, but (perhaps) a daffodil head dress.

The concept of a load of boys playing Flower Fairies would have been a tough sell for any music teacher!  :)
